SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.uce.userlab.haptics.HD
Class HDAPI

java.lang.Object
  com.uce.userlab.haptics.HD.HDAPI

public class HDAPI
extends java.lang.Object

This Class is the Java Implementation of OpenHaptics API HDAPI, this class is includes all the methods needed to manage and use the device. It is not recommended to use this class as direct interface to any haptic device within an application, it is recommended you use an implementation of Device interface where possible. This class should be used when implementing new Device classes, or for very complex device management. It is also very good if you have experience using C/C++ OpenHaptics Toolkit already.

Constructor Detail

HDAPI

public HDAPI()
Method Detail

hdBeginFrame

public static void hdBeginFrame(int hHD)
                         throws HDException
Begins an haptic frame, this opens a block of code that guarantee consistance

Parameters:
hHD - The haptic device identifier given to you by hdInitDevice
Throws:
HDException - If frame has already been open or is unable to open frame

hdDisable

public static void hdDisable(int cap)
                      throws HDException
Disables a capability that is specified

Parameters:
cap - The Capability to disable, see following list
  • HD_FORCE_OUTPUT
  • HD_MAX_FORCE_CLAMPING
  • HD_FORCE_RAMPING
  • HD_SOFTWARE_FORCE_LIMIT
  • HD_SOFTWARE_FORCE_IMPULSE_LIMIT
  • HD_SOFTWARE_VELOCITY_LIMIT
  • HD_ONE_FRAME_LIMIT
Throws:
HDException - If the capability is not able to be disabled or is unknown

hdDisableDevice

public static void hdDisableDevice(int hHD)
Disables a device, renders current handler un-usable

Parameters:
hHD - The haptic device identifier given to you by hdInitDevice

hdEnable

public static void hdEnable(int cap)
                     throws HDException
Enables a capability that is specified

Parameters:
cap - The Capability to enable, see following list
  • HD_FORCE_OUTPUT
  • HD_MAX_FORCE_CLAMPING
  • HD_FORCE_RAMPING
  • HD_SOFTWARE_FORCE_LIMIT
  • HD_SOFTWARE_FORCE_IMPULSE_LIMIT
  • HD_SOFTWARE_VELOCITY_LIMIT
  • HD_ONE_FRAME_LIMIT
Throws:
HDException - If the capability is not able to be enabled or is unknown

hdEndFrame

public static void hdEndFrame(int hHD)
                       throws HDException
Ends an haptic frame, this closes a block of code that guarantees consistance

Parameters:
hHD - The haptic device identifier given to you by hdInitDevice
Throws:
HDException - If frame is not open or is unable to be closed

hdGetBooleanv

public static boolean[] hdGetBooleanv(int cap)
                               throws HDException
Gets information in the form of a boolean value from device for a give capability

Parameters:
cap - The Capability to return the value for
Returns:
Boolean Array of varying sizes depending on capability specified
Throws:
HDException - If the capability is unable to return a boolean value or a value at all

Returns:

hdGetCurrentDevice

public static int hdGetCurrentDevice()
                              throws HDException
Returns the identifier for the current device

Returns:
The identifier for the current device
Throws:
HDException - If no device is current, this can happen if no device has been initiated

hdGetString

public static java.lang.String hdGetString(int cap)
                                    throws HDException
Gets the String value for an associated parameter name

Parameters:
cap - The Capability/Parameter name to return String for
Returns:
The Sting value for the Capability/Parameter specified
Throws:
HDException - If the Capability does not support String as an input, or is the Capability is Unknown

hdInitDevice

public static int hdInitDevice(java.lang.String configName)
                        throws HDException
Initializes devices depending on specified device names (e.g. "Default PHANToM")

Parameters:
configName - The name of the device to initialize
Returns:
An identifier for the Haptic device that has been initialized
Throws:
HDException - If the device is already intialized or if the device has a fault

hdIsEnabled

public static boolean hdIsEnabled(int cap)
                           throws HDException
Checks if a specified capability is enabled or not

Parameters:
cap - The Capability to check if is enabled or not
Returns:
Boolean value, true if enabled and false if disabled
Throws:
HDException - If the Capability is not able to be enabled or disabled, or if the Capability is Unknown

hdMakeCurrentDevice

public static void hdMakeCurrentDevice(int hHD)
                                throws HDException
Makes the specified device the current device

Parameters:
hHD - The haptic device identifier given to you by hdInitDevice
Throws:
HDException - If the device is Unknown

hdSetBooleanv

public static void hdSetBooleanv(int cap,
                                 boolean[] v)
                          throws HDException
Sets information in the form of a boolean value for a give device capability

Parameters:
cap - The Capability to set the value for
v - Boolean Array with the information to use to set the capability to
Throws:
HDException - If the capability is unable to be set to a boolean value or a value at all

hdCheckCalibration

public static int hdCheckCalibration()
                              throws HDException
Checks the Calibration state of the current device

Returns:
The Status of the Calibration for the current device in the form of identifiers
  • HD_CALIBRATION_OK
  • HD_CALIBRATION_NEEDS_UPDATE
  • HD_CALIBRATION_NEEDS_MANUAL_INPUT
Throws:
HDException - If there is a device fault and the Calibration state could not be obtainned

hdUpdateCalibration

public static void hdUpdateCalibration(int cap)
                                throws HDException
Calibrates the current device depending on the Style Specified

Parameters:
cap - The Style of the Calibration to perform on the device
Throws:
HDException - If there is a device fault and the Calibration could not be carried out

hdGetSchedulerTimeStamp

public static double hdGetSchedulerTimeStamp()
Returns elapse time since the start of the servo loop

Returns:
A double value of the time that has elapse since the start of the servo loop

hdScheduleAsynchronous

public static int hdScheduleAsynchronous(HDCallback par,
                                         java.lang.Object[] obj,
                                         short cap)
                                  throws HDException
Set the Callback from the scheduler to be Asynchronous, so it won't wait for completion before calling again

Parameters:
par - The Object to callback to
obj - Array of Objects to store and to pass back every callback as a parameter to HDCallback Object
cap - The priority to give the callback in the loop
Returns:
The handler for that callback so it can be unscheduled later
Throws:
HDException - If the scheduler is full and if the priority thats set is incorrect.

hdScheduleSynchronous

public static void hdScheduleSynchronous(HDCallback par,
                                         java.lang.Object[] obj,
                                         short cap)
                                  throws HDException
Set the Callback from the scheduler to be Synchronous, so it will wait till completion before calling again

Parameters:
par - The Object to callback to
obj - Array of Objects to store and to pass back every callback as a parameter to HDCallback Object
cap - The priority to give the callback in the loop
Throws:
HDException - If the scheduler is full and if the priority thats set is incorrect.

hdSetSchedulerRate

public static void hdSetSchedulerRate(long rate)
                               throws HDException
Sets the number of times the scheduler ticks before it Callback

Parameters:
rate - The rate to Callback, Hz
Throws:
HDException - If rate is not a valid rate in Hz

hdStartScheduler

public static void hdStartScheduler()
                             throws HDException
Starts the Scheduler's Callback from the Servo Loop

Throws:
HDException - If the servo loop thread could not be initialized

hdStopScheduler

public static void hdStopScheduler()
                            throws HDException
Stops the Scheduler's Callback from the Servo Loop

Throws:
HDException - If the servo loop thread could not be initialized or stop for any reason

hdUnschedule

public static void hdUnschedule(int handler)
Unschedule the call back for an asynchronous scheduler

Parameters:
handler - The handler for the asynchronous callback, returned by hdScheduleAsynchronous method

hdWaitForCompletion

public static boolean hdWaitForCompletion(int cap)
Checks the callback is still scheduled to execution

Parameters:
cap - The type of wait that is required
  • HD_WAIT_CHECK_STATUS
  • HD_WAIT_INFINITE
Returns:
Boolean value, true if the callback is scheduled or false if it is not
